metadata.description: Core respiratory and visceral reflexes linking diaphragm, intercostals, and abdominal pressurization.
metadata.notes: Focuses on trunk-centric automatic responses distinct from biomimetic respiratory control files.

cough.stimulus: Irritation of tracheobronchial mucosa or elevated airway particulate load.
cough.afferent: Vagal rapidly adapting receptors → nucleus tractus solitarius.
cough.integration: Medullary cough pattern generator coordinating thoracoabdominal musculature.
cough.efferent: Phrenic, intercostal, and abdominal motor pathways.
cough.effector: Inspiration followed by glottic closure and explosive expiratory burst.
cough.notes: Clears airway and resets thoracic pressure.

sneeze.integration: Brainstem relay recruiting respiratory drive and facial motor nuclei.
sneeze.efferent: Phrenic, spinal expiratory motor neurons, facial nerve branches for eye closure.
sneeze.effector: Forceful expiratory blast with nasal/oral expulsion.
sneeze.notes: Expels irritants from upper airway while stabilizing thorax.

hiccough.stimulus: Sudden gastric distension or diaphragmatic irritation.
hiccough.afferent: Phrenic and vagal afferents → medullary pattern generator.
hiccough.integration: Rhythmic burst generator producing synchronous diaphragm contractions.
hiccough.efferent: Phrenic motor neurons with transient glottic closure via recurrent laryngeal branch.
hiccough.effector: Brief inspiratory snatch accompanied by momentary glottic closure.
hiccough.notes: Typically self-limited; modulates thoracoabdominal pressure cycles.

diaphragm_spasm.stimulus: Sustained noxious or metabolic stress on diaphragmatic muscle.
diaphragm_spasm.afferent: Phrenic sensory collaterals and sympathetic afferents.
diaphragm_spasm.integration: Medullary respiratory centers with spinal interneuron reinforcement.
diaphragm_spasm.efferent: Phrenic motor axons firing high-frequency bursts.
diaphragm_spasm.effector: Tetanic diaphragm contraction reducing tidal exchange.
diaphragm_spasm.notes: Signals overload of respiratory drive and can interrupt normal breathing rhythm.
